Creator Subject:
	Security ID:		S-1-5-21-2264196694-1469429678-912427992-1104
	Account Name:		frank.kolzig
	Account Domain:		STACKEDPADS
	Logon ID:		0x16307A

Target Subject:
	Security ID:		S-1-0-0
	Account Name:		-
	Account Domain:		-

Process Information:
	New Process ID:		0x1154
	New Process Name:	C:\Windows\System32\whoami.exe
	Token Elevation Type:	%%1938
	Mandatory Label:		S-1-16-8192
	Creator Process ID:	0x760
	Creator Process Name:	C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe
	Process Command Line:	whoami

Token Elevation Type indicates the type of token that was assigned to the new process in accordance with User Account Control policy.

Type 1 is a full token with no privileges removed or groups disabled.  A full token is only used if User Account Control is disabled or if the user is the built-in Administrator account or a service account.

Type 2 is an elevated token with no privileges removed or groups disabled.  An elevated token is used when User Account Control is enabled and the user chooses to start the program using Run as administrator.  An elevated token is also used when an application is configured to always require administrative privilege or to always require maximum privilege, and the user is a member of the Administrators group.

Type 3 is a limited token with administrative privileges removed and administrative groups disabled.  The limited token is used when User Account Control is enabled, the application does not require administrative privilege, and the user does not choose to start the program using Run as administrator.","Category":"Process Creation","Opcode":"Info","SubjectUserSid":"S-1-5-21-2264196694-1469429678-912427992-1104","SubjectUserName":"frank.kolzig","SubjectDomainName":"STACKEDPADS","SubjectLogonId":"0x16307a","NewProcessId":"0x1154","NewProcessName":"C:\Windows\System32\whoami.exe","TokenElevationType":"%%1938","CommandLine":"whoami","TargetUserSid":"S-1-0-0","TargetUserName":"-","TargetDomainName":"-","TargetLogonId":"0x0","ParentProcessName":"C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe","MandatoryLabel":"S-1-16-8192","EventReceivedTime":1730091700,"SourceModuleName":"in_default_channels","SourceModuleType":"im_msvistalog"}

Creator Subject:
	Security ID:		S-1-5-21-2264196694-1469429678-912427992-1104
	Account Name:		frank.kolzig
	Account Domain:		STACKEDPADS
	Logon ID:		0x16307A

Target Subject:

	New Process ID:		0x1154

	Token Elevation Type:	%%1938
	Mandatory Label:		S-1-16-8192
	Creator Process ID:	0x760
	Creator Process Name:	C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe
	Process Command Line:	whoami

Token Elevation Type indicates the type of token that was assigned to the new process in accordance with User Account Control policy.

Type 1 is a full token with no privileges removed or groups disabled.  A full token is only used if User Account Control is disabled or if the user is the built-in Administrator account or a service account.

Type 2 is an elevated token with no privileges removed or groups disabled.  An elevated token is used when User Account Control is enabled and the user chooses to start the program using Run as administrator.  An elevated token is also used when an application is configured to always require administrative privilege or to always require maximum privilege, and the user is a member of the Administrators group.

Type 3 is a limited token with administrative privileges removed and administrative groups disabled.  The limited token is used when User Account Control is enabled, the application does not require administrative privilege, and the user does not choose to start the program using Run as administrator.","Category":"Process Creation","Opcode":"Info","SubjectUserSid":"S-1-5-21-2264196694-1469429678-912427992-1104","SubjectUserName":"frank.kolzig","SubjectDomainName":"STACKEDPADS","SubjectLogonId":"0x16307a","NewProcessId":"0x1154","NewProcessName":"C:\Windows\System32\whoami.exe","TokenElevationType":"%%1938","CommandLine":"whoami","TargetUserSid":"S-1-0-0","TargetUserName":"-","TargetDomainName":"-","TargetLogonId":"0x0","ParentProcessName":"C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe","MandatoryLabel":"S-1-16-8192","EventReceivedTime":1730696496,"SourceModuleName":"in_default_channels","SourceModuleType":"im_msvistalog"}

Creator Subject:
	Security ID:		S-1-5-21-2264196694-1469429678-912427992-1104
	Account Name:		frank.kolzig
	Account Domain:		STACKEDPADS
	Logon ID:		0x16307A

Target Subject:
	Security ID:		S-1-0-0
	Account Name:		-
	Account Domain:		-
	Logon ID:		0x0

Process Information:
	New Process ID:		0x1154
	New Process Name:	C:\Windows\System32\whoami.exe
	Token Elevation Type:	%%1938
	Mandatory Label:		S-1-16-8192
	Creator Process ID:	0x760
	Creator Process Name:	C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe
	Process Command Line:	whoami

Token Elevation Type indicates the type of token that was assigned to the new process in accordance with User Account Control policy.

Type 1 is a full token with no privileges removed or groups disabled.  A full token is only used if User Account Control is disabled or if the user is the built-in Administrator account or a service account.

Type 2 is an elevated token with no privileges removed or groups disabled.  An elevated token is used when User Account Control is enabled and the user chooses to start the program using Run as administrator.  An elevated token is also used when an application is configured to always require administrative privilege or to always require maximum privilege, and the user is a member of the Administrators group.

Type 3 is a limited token with administrative privileges removed and administrative groups disabled.  The limited token is used when User Account Control is enabled, the application does not require administrative privilege, and the user does not choose to start the program using Run as administrator.","Category":"Process Creation","Opcode":"Info","SubjectUserSid":"S-1-5-21-2264196694-1469429678-912427992-1104","SubjectUserName":"frank.kolzig","SubjectDomainName":"STACKEDPADS","SubjectLogonId":"0x16307a","NewProcessId":"0x1154","NewProcessName":"C:\Windows\System32\whoami.exe","TokenElevationType":"%%1938","CommandLine":"whoami","TargetUserSid":"S-1-0-0","TargetUserName":"-","TargetDomainName":"-","TargetLogonId":"0x0","ParentProcessName":"C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe","MandatoryLabel":"S-1-16-8192","EventReceivedTime":1716609695,"SourceModuleName":"in_default_channels","SourceModuleType":"im_msvistalog"}

327.alert_brief: Detects the execution of whoami, which is often used by attackers after exploitation to establish what credentials they are logged in underwhoami.exe launched by cmd.exe
ini_data:
<14>Jun 26 04:54:49 wrk-shasek.stackedpads.local Microsoft-Windows-Security-Auditing[4]: {"EventTime":1719291287,"Hostname":"wrk-shasek.stackedpads.local","Keywords":-9214364837600034816,"EventType":"AUDIT_SUCCESS","SeverityValue":2,"Severity":"INFO","EventID":4688,"SourceName":"Microsoft-Windows-Security-Auditing","ProviderGuid":"{54849625-5478-4994-A5BA-3E3B0328C30D}","Version":2,"Task":13312,"OpcodeValue":0,"RecordNumber":2716571,"ProcessID":4,"ThreadID":5804,"Channel":"Security","Message":"A new process has been created.

Creator Subject:
	Security ID:		S-1-5-21-2264196694-1469429678-912427992-1106
	Account Name:		steve.hasek
	Account Domain:		STACKEDPADS
	Logon ID:		0x686995

Target Subject:
	Security ID:		S-1-0-0
	Account Name:		-
	Account Domain:		-
	Logon ID:		0x0

Process Information:
	New Process ID:		0x8b0
	New Process Name:	C:\Windows\System32\whoami.exe
	Token Elevation Type:	%%1937
	Mandatory Label:		S-1-16-12288
	Creator Process ID:	0x8f4
	Creator Process Name:	C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe
	Process Command Line:	whoami

Token Elevation Type indicates the type of token that was assigned to the new process in accordance with User Account Control policy.

Type 1 is a full token with no privileges removed or groups disabled.  A full token is only used if User Account Control is disabled or if the user is the built-in Administrator account or a service account.

Type 2 is an elevated token with no privileges removed or groups disabled.  An elevated token is used when User Account Control is enabled and the user chooses to start the program using Run as administrator.  An elevated token is also used when an application is configured to always require administrative privilege or to always require maximum privilege, and the user is a member of the Administrators group.

Type 3 is a limited token with administrative privileges removed and administrative groups disabled.  The limited token is used when User Account Control is enabled, the application does not require administrative privilege, and the user does not choose to start the program using Run as administrator.","Category":"Process Creation","Opcode":"Info","SubjectUserSid":"S-1-5-21-2264196694-1469429678-912427992-1106","SubjectUserName":"steve.hasek","SubjectDomainName":"STACKEDPADS","SubjectLogonId":"0x686995","NewProcessId":"0x8b0","NewProcessName":"C:\Windows\System32\whoami.exe","TokenElevationType":"%%1937","CommandLine":"whoami","TargetUserSid":"S-1-0-0","TargetUserName":"-","TargetDomainName":"-","TargetLogonId":"0x0","ParentProcessName":"C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe","MandatoryLabel":"S-1-16-12288","EventReceivedTime":1719291289,"SourceModuleName":"in_default_channels","SourceModuleType":"im_msvistalog"}

Type 1 is a full token with no privileges removed or groups disabled.  A full token is only used if User Account Control is disabled or if the user is the built-in Administrator account or a service account.

Type 2 is an elevated token with no privileges removed or groups disabled.  An elevated token is used when User Account Control is enabled and the user chooses to start the program using Run as administrator.  An elevated token is also used when an application is configured to always require administrative privilege or to always require maximum privilege, and the user is a member of the Administrators group.

Type 3 is a limited token with administrative privileges removed and administrative groups disabled.  The limited token is used when User Account Control is enabled, the application does not require administrative privilege, and the user does not choose to start the program using Run as administrator.","Category":"Process Creation","Opcode":"Info","SubjectUserSid":"S-1-5-21-2264196694-1469429678-912427992-1104","SubjectUserName":"frank.kolzig","SubjectDomainName":"STACKEDPADS","SubjectLogonId":"0x16307a","NewProcessId":"0x1154","NewProcessName":"C:\Windows\System32\whoami.exe","TokenElevationType":"%%1938","CommandLine":"whoami","TargetUserSid":"S-1-0-0","TargetUserName":"-","TargetDomainName":"-","TargetLogonId":"0x0","ParentProcessName":"C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe","MandatoryLabel":"S-1-16-8192","EventReceivedTime":1718510495,"SourceModuleName":"in_default_channels","SourceModuleType":"im_msvistalog"}

Creator Subject:
	Security ID:		S-1-5-21-2264196694-1469429678-912427992-1104
	Account Name:		frank.kolzig
	Account Domain:		STACKEDPADS
	Logon ID:		0x16307A

Target Subject:
	Security ID:		S-1-0-0
	Account Name:		-
	Account Domain:		-
	Logon ID:		0x0

Process Information:
	New Process ID:		0x1154
	New Process Name:	C:\Windows\System32\whoami.exe
	Token Elevation Type:	%%1938
	Mandatory Label:		S-1-16-8192
	Creator Process ID:	0x760
	Creator Process Name:	C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe
	Process Command Line:	whoami

Token Elevation Type indicates the type of token that was assigned to the new process in accordance with User Account Control policy.

Type 1 is a full token with no privileges removed or groups disabled.  A full token is only used if User Account Control is disabled or if the user is the built-in Administrator account or a service account.

Type 2 is an elevated token with no privileges removed or groups disabled.  An elevated token is used when User Account Control is enabled and the user chooses to start the program using Run as administrator.  An elevated token is also used when an application is configured to always require administrative privilege or to always require maximum privilege, and the user is a member of the Administrators group.

Type 3 is a limited token with administrative privileges removed and administrative groups disabled.  The limited token is used when User Account Control is enabled, the application does not require administrative privilege, and the user does not choose to start the program using Run as administrator.","Category":"Process Creation","Opcode":"Info","SubjectUserSid":"S-1-5-21-2264196694-1469429678-912427992-1104","SubjectUserName":"frank.kolzig","SubjectDomainName":"STACKEDPADS","SubjectLogonId":"0x16307a","NewProcessId":"0x1154","NewProcessName":"C:\Windows\System32\whoami.exe","TokenElevationType":"%%1938","CommandLine":"whoami","TargetUserSid":"S-1-0-0","TargetUserName":"-","TargetDomainName":"-","TargetLogonId":"0x0","ParentProcessName":"C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe","MandatoryLabel":"S-1-16-8192","EventReceivedTime":1715572895,"SourceModuleName":"in_default_channels","SourceModuleType":"im_msvistalog"}

467.alert_brief: Detects the execution of whoami, which is often used by attackers after exploitation to establish what credentials they are logged in underwhoami.exe launched by cmd.exe
ini_data:
<14>Aug 29 04:54:49 wrk-shasek.stackedpads.local Microsoft-Windows-Security-Auditing[4]: {"EventTime":1724820887,"Hostname":"wrk-shasek.stackedpads.local","Keywords":-9214364837600034816,"EventType":"AUDIT_SUCCESS","SeverityValue":2,"Severity":"INFO","EventID":4688,"SourceName":"Microsoft-Windows-Security-Auditing","ProviderGuid":"{54849625-5478-4994-A5BA-3E3B0328C30D}","Version":2,"Task":13312,"OpcodeValue":0,"RecordNumber":2716571,"ProcessID":4,"ThreadID":5804,"Channel":"Security","Message":"A new process has been created.

Creator Subject:
	Security ID:		S-1-5-21-2264196694-1469429678-912427992-1106
	Account Name:		steve.hasek
	Account Domain:		STACKEDPADS
	Logon ID:		0x686995

Target Subject:
	Security ID:		S-1-0-0
	Account Name:		-
	Account Domain:		-
	Logon ID:		0x0

Process Information:
	New Process ID:		0x8b0
	New Process Name:	C:\Windows\System32\whoami.exe
	Token Elevation Type:	%%1937
	Mandatory Label:		S-1-16-12288
	Creator Process ID:	0x8f4
	Creator Process Name:	C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe
	Process Command Line:	whoami

Token Elevation Type indicates the type of token that was assigned to the new process in accordance with User Account Control policy.

Type 1 is a full token with no privileges removed or groups disabled.  A full token is only used if User Account Control is disabled or if the user is the built-in Administrator account or a service account.

Type 2 is an elevated token with no privileges removed or groups disabled.  An elevated token is used when User Account Control is enabled and the user chooses to start the program using Run as administrator.  An elevated token is also used when an application is configured to always require administrative privilege or to always require maximum privilege, and the user is a member of the Administrators group.

Type 3 is a limited token with administrative privileges removed and administrative groups disabled.  The limited token is used when User Account Control is enabled, the application does not require administrative privilege, and the user does not choose to start the program using Run as administrator.","Category":"Process Creation","Opcode":"Info","SubjectUserSid":"S-1-5-21-2264196694-1469429678-912427992-1106","SubjectUserName":"steve.hasek","SubjectDomainName":"STACKEDPADS","SubjectLogonId":"0x686995","NewProcessId":"0x8b0","NewProcessName":"C:\Windows\System32\whoami.exe","TokenElevationType":"%%1937","CommandLine":"whoami","TargetUserSid":"S-1-0-0","TargetUserName":"-","TargetDomainName":"-","TargetLogonId":"0x0","ParentProcessName":"C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe","MandatoryLabel":"S-1-16-12288","EventReceivedTime":1724820889,"SourceModuleName":"in_default_channels","SourceModuleType":"im_msvistalog"}

<14>Jun 14 04:01:35 activedir.stackedpads.local Microsoft-Windows-Security-Auditing[4]: {"EventTime":1718251294,"Hostname":"activedir.stackedpads.local","Keywords":-9214364837600034816,"EventType":"AUDIT_SUCCESS","SeverityValue":2,"Severity":"INFO","EventID":4688,"SourceName":"Microsoft-Windows-Security-Auditing","ProviderGuid":"{54849625-5478-4994-A5BA-3E3B0328C30D}","Version":2,"Task":13312,"OpcodeValue":0,"RecordNumber":510442,"ProcessID":4,"ThreadID":304,"Channel":"Security","Message":"A new process has been created.

Creator Subject:
	Security ID:		S-1-5-21-2264196694-1469429678-912427992-1104
	Account Name:		frank.kolzig
	Account Domain:		STACKEDPADS
	Logon ID:		0x16307A

Target Subject:
	Security ID:		S-1-0-0
	Account Name:		-
	Account Domain:		-
	Logon ID:		0x0

Process Information:
	New Process ID:		0x1154
	New Process Name:	C:\Windows\System32\whoami.exe
	Token Elevation Type:	%%1938
	Mandatory Label:		S-1-16-8192
	Creator Process ID:	0x760
	Creator Process Name:	C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe
	Process Command Line:	whoami

Token Elevation Type indicates the type of token that was assigned to the new process in accordance with User Account Control policy.

Type 1 is a full token with no privileges removed or groups disabled.  A full token is only used if User Account Control is disabled or if the user is the built-in Administrator account or a service account.

Type 2 is an elevated token with no privileges removed or groups disabled.  An elevated token is used when User Account Control is enabled and the user chooses to start the program using Run as administrator.  An elevated token is also used when an application is configured to always require administrative privilege or to always require maximum privilege, and the user is a member of the Administrators group.

Type 3 is a limited token with administrative privileges removed and administrative groups disabled.  The limited token is used when User Account Control is enabled, the application does not require administrative privilege, and the user does not choose to start the program using Run as administrator.","Category":"Process Creation","Opcode":"Info","SubjectUserSid":"S-1-5-21-2264196694-1469429678-912427992-1104","SubjectUserName":"frank.kolzig","SubjectDomainName":"STACKEDPADS","SubjectLogonId":"0x16307a","NewProcessId":"0x1154","NewProcessName":"C:\Windows\System32\whoami.exe","TokenElevationType":"%%1938","CommandLine":"whoami","TargetUserSid":"S-1-0-0","TargetUserName":"-","TargetDomainName":"-","TargetLogonId":"0x0","ParentProcessName":"C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe","MandatoryLabel":"S-1-16-8192","EventReceivedTime":1718251295,"SourceModuleName":"in_default_channels","SourceModuleType":"im_msvistalog"}

<14>Aug 02 04:54:49 wrk-shasek.stackedpads.local Microsoft-Windows-Security-Auditing[4]: {"EventTime":1722488087,"Hostname":"wrk-shasek.stackedpads.local","Keywords":-9214364837600034816,"EventType":"AUDIT_SUCCESS","SeverityValue":2,"Severity":"INFO","EventID":4688,"SourceName":"Microsoft-Windows-Security-Auditing","ProviderGuid":"{54849625-5478-4994-A5BA-3E3B0328C30D}","Version":2,"Task":13312,"OpcodeValue":0,"RecordNumber":2716571,"ProcessID":4,"ThreadID":5804,"Channel":"Security","Message":"A new process has been created.

Creator Subject:
	Security ID:		S-1-5-21-2264196694-1469429678-912427992-1106
	Account Name:		steve.hasek
	Account Domain:		STACKEDPADS
	Logon ID:		0x686995

Target Subject:

	Account Name:		-
	Account Domain:		-
	Logon ID:		0x0

Process Information:
	New Process ID:		0x8b0
	New Process Name:	C:\Windows\System32\whoami.exe
	Token Elevation Type:	%%1937
	Mandatory Label:		S-1-16-12288
	Creator Process ID:	0x8f4
	Creator Process Name:	C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe
	Process Command Line:	whoami

Token Elevation Type indicates the type of token that was assigned to the new process in accordance with User Account Control policy.

Type 1 is a full token with no privileges removed or groups disabled.  A full token is only used if User Account Control is disabled or if the user is the built-in Administrator account or a service account.

Type 2 is an elevated token with no privileges removed or groups disabled.  An elevated token is used when User Account Control is enabled and the user chooses to start the program using Run as administrator.  An elevated token is also used when an application is configured to always require administrative privilege or to always require maximum privilege, and the user is a member of the Administrators group.

Type 3 is a limited token with administrative privileges removed and administrative groups disabled.  The limited token is used when User Account Control is enabled, the application does not require administrative privilege, and the user does not choose to start the program using Run as administrator.","Category":"Process Creation","Opcode":"Info","SubjectUserSid":"S-1-5-21-2264196694-1469429678-912427992-1106","SubjectUserName":"steve.hasek","SubjectDomainName":"STACKEDPADS","SubjectLogonId":"0x686995","NewProcessId":"0x8b0","NewProcessName":"C:\Windows\System32\whoami.exe","TokenElevationType":"%%1937","CommandLine":"whoami","TargetUserSid":"S-1-0-0","TargetUserName":"-","TargetDomainName":"-","TargetLogonId":"0x0","ParentProcessName":"C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe","MandatoryLabel":"S-1-16-12288","EventReceivedTime":1722488089,"SourceModuleName":"in_default_channels","SourceModuleType":"im_msvistalog"}
